mesquite.lib.characters

Interface CharacterStatesHolder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Listable, Renamable, WithStringDetails
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AdjustableDistribution, CharacterDistribution, CharacterHistory, SlicedCharacterHistory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalAdjustable, CategoricalDistribution, CategoricalEmbedded, CategoricalHistory, CategoricalStates, CharacterStates, ContinuousAdjustable, ContinuousDistribution, ContinuousEmbedded, ContinuousHistory, ContinuousStates, DNACharacterAdjustable, DNACharacterHistory, DNAEmbedded, GeographicAdjustable, GeographicStates, MeristicAdjustable, MeristicDistribution, MeristicEmbedded, MeristicHistory, MeristicStates, ProteinAdjustable, ProteinCharacterHistory, ProteinEmbedded, RNACharacterAdjustable, RNACharacterHistory

    public interface CharacterStatesHolder
extends Listable, Renamable, WithStringDetails
    Stores the character states at a series of terminal taxa or nodes in a tree. The class on which both CharacterDistribution and CharacterHistory are based. See general discussion of character storage classes under CharacterState

      • getDefaultModel

        CharacterModel getDefaultModel(MesquiteProject proj,
                               java.lang.String paradigm)
        passed the file, finds the default character model. This is not done well yet. Should be passed the paradigm. Is passed the so the CharacterModel object can be looked up

      • getTaxa

        Taxa getTaxa()
        Returns the Taxa to which this applies

      • getNumTaxa

        int getNumTaxa()
        This is the same as getNumNodes. This may be unexpected, because it does NOT necessarily give the same results as getTaxa().getNumTaxa(). For instance, if this is a CharacterHistory, then this is the same as number of nodes, not the number of terminal taxa. The reason for this unusual usage is that

      • getNumNodes

        int getNumNodes()
        returns number of nodes for which CharacterStates is defined (either terminal taxa, if CharacterDistribution, or all nodes in tree, if CharacterHistory)

      • getParentData

        CharacterData getParentData()
        returns parent data of this CharacterStates. There is not a corresponding set procedure because the parent data is set either by the constructor (for Embedded distributions) or by a set procedure (for History or Adjustables)

      • getParentCharacter

        int getParentCharacter()
        returns parent character of this CharacterStates
